text:
70M h/o ulcerative colitis, coronary disease s/p MI and CABG, CVA, CRI,
   Afib on coumadin, recent diagnosis cirrhosis c/b esophageal varices
   presents from floor with hypotension, hypoxia, and tachypnea. The
   patient intitally presented one week ago on [**12-2**] with 2 days decreased
   PO intake, vomiting, and bloody diarrhea. he was hypotensive at
   presentation.  He was volume resuscitated in the ICU and treated with
   cipro for empiric SBP coverage, given that a small pocket of
   non-tappable ascites was detected on abdominal CT. He was called out to
   the floor once his blood pressures stabilized.
   On the floor, he was continued on Cipro for SBP treatment. His
   diuretics were held  in the setting of ARF on CRI. Cardiology was
   contact[**Name (NI) **] for continued management of his systolic CHF and Atrial
   fibrillation. On [**12-6**], the patient was restarted on Coumadin for his
   Afib , despite continued maroon, guaiac positive stools which have been
   attributed to his newly dx UC. On [**12-7**] early AM, patient Triggered for
   respiratory distress and hypoxia. He was given Lasix 40mg IV and CXR
   was obtained that revealed pulmonary edema vs multifocal PNA.
   Throughout the day of [**12-7**], he continued with hypotension as his blood
   pressure decreased from 128/66 to 98/50, he also had an increased O2
   requirement. He received a second dose of lasix yet remained hypoxic,
   with abg 7.30/32/43.
   Diabetes Mellitus (DM), Type II
   Assessment:
   BSFS 297-320. MD aware
   Action:
   Given insilun Sc by RISS
   Response:
   In the morning 172. pt remains NPO except meds
   Plan:
   ?increased sliding scale, cont monitoring BS
   Hypoxemia
   Assessment:
   Received on mask 7L, ABG sent, sat 92-93%. LS rhonchi/crackles at bases
   with some wheezing. Hypoxia possible d/t CHF vs PNA.
   Action:
   Changed to NRB, sat 100%, ABG: 7.43/25/63, start nebs tx.trying to wean
   NRB to 70% cool neb mask. Sputum sent . NTS done x2, suction  bloody
   secretion. Start on Aztreonam/Levofloxacin, cont Vanco
   Response:
   Pt desat to 90% on 70%. While mask off pt desat to 88%
   Plan:
   Wean O2. follow ABG, cont nebs.cont ABX
   Hypotension (not Shock)
   Assessment:
   Pt
s Bp 90-100
   Action:
   Cont follow Bp
   Response:
   Bp remains on mid 90
   Plan:
   Cont follow hemodinamacl status
   1.       Pt  confused, oriented in himself only, possible needs sitter
   in the morning.
   2.       Pt refused to take meds po saying: I can
t take
   3.       2 sets of blood cx sent.
   4.       Electronically signed by [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) 1746**] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 1747**], RN  [**2190-12-8**] 06:21
